metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Hydrometeorological observation network obtained from an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Sidaoqiao Superstation between 11 July, 2013, and 31 December, 2013. The site (101.137° E, 42.001° N) was located on a tamarix (Tamarix chinensis Lour.) surface in the Sidaoqiao, Dalaihubu Town, Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 873 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HC2S3; 5, 7, 10, 15, 20 and 28 m, towards north), wind speed profile (010C; 5, 7, 10, 15, 20 and 28 m, towards north), wind direction profile (020C; 15 m, towards north), air pressure (CS100; in waterproof box), rain gauge (TE525M; 28 m, towards south), four-component radiometer (CNR4; 10 m, towards south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 10 m, towards south, vertically downward), two photosynthetically active radiation (PQS-1; 10 m, towards south, one vertically upward and one vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01SC; 3 duplicates with G1 below the tamarix; G2 and G3 between plants, -0.06 m), a TCAV averaging soil thermocouple probe (installed on 17 July, 2013, TCAV; -0.02, -0.04 m), soil temperature profile (109ss-L; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2 and -1.6 m), and soil moisture profile (install on 7 December, 2013, ML2X; -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2 and -1.6 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m, Ta_7 m, Ta_10 m, Ta_15 m, Ta_20 m and Ta_28 m; RH_5 m, RH_7 m, RH_10 m, RH_15 m, RH_20 m and RH_28 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_5 m, Ws_7 m, Ws_10 m, Ws_15 m, Ws_20 m and Ws_28 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_15 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_up and PAR_down) (μmol/ (s m^-2)), average soil temperature (TCAV, ℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm and Ts_160 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm and Ms_160 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The wind speed (10 m height) data were missing before 12 November, 2013 because of the sensor problem. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2013-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), Liu et al. (2011) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2013年7月11日至2013年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游四道桥超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1374E, 42.0012N，海拔873m。空气温度、相对湿度、风速传感器分别架设在5m、7m、10m、15m、20m、28m处，共6层，朝向正北；风向传感器架设在15m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；四分量辐射仪安装在10m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在10m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在10m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤部分传感器安装在塔体南侧2m处，其中土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，土壤热流板G1埋设在柽柳下方，G2和G3埋设在裸地；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV（2013年7月17日安装）埋设在地下2cm、4cm处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处；土壤水分传感器（2013年12月7日安装）分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处。
观测项目有：风速（WS_5m、WS_7m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_15m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_5m、Ta_7m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_28m和RH_5m、RH_7m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、向上和向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；10m风速在2013年11月12日之前由于仪器问题，期间以-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2013-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在实际的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在EC通量测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面与空气温度差异不确定性的影响。有时，这种差异由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，另一个因素是该区域强烈的对流环境。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是多尺度蒸散发观测实验的一部分，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 compare to the methods applied in the oasis–desert systems for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验中使用的数据收集方法与在绿洲-沙漠系统中用于捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳交换的方法相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 involves a detailed meteorological observation network with multiple layers of sensors measuring variables like wind speed, air temperature, and soil moisture at different heights and depths, ensuring comprehensive meteorological data capture. In contrast, the data collection in oasis–desert systems uses eddy covariance and scintillometers for capturing turbulent fluxes and employs automatic weather stations to gather comprehensive hydrometeorological data, along with vegetation and soil parameters. Both approaches emphasize capturing detailed meteorological and environmental data, yet they utilize different instruments and setups tailored to their respective research focus.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验涉及一个详细的气象观测网络，配备多层传感器，测量风速、气温和土壤湿度等变量，确保全面的气象数据捕获。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统的数据收集使用涡度协方差法和闪烁仪来捕获湍流通量，并采用自动气象站收集全面的水文气象数据，以及植被和土壤参数。这两种方法都强调捕获详细的气象和环境数据，但它们使用不同的仪器和设置，针对各自的研究重点。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences in the challenges faced during data collection in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 and the oasis–desert ecosystem studies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验和绿洲–沙漠生态系统研究在数据收集过程中面临的挑战有哪些相似之处和不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 and oasis–desert ecosystem studies face challenges related to ensuring accurate and complete data collection under varying environmental conditions. In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, challenges include ensuring data completeness and handling missing or erroneous data, which is marked with specific indicators. Meanwhile, oasis–desert ecosystem studies must address environmental degradation issues, such as land desertification and ecological imbalances, while also managing data quality from long-term observations. Despite these differences, both emphasize robust data processing and quality control procedures.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验和绿洲-沙漠生态系统研究都面临在不同环境条件下确保准确和完整数据收集的挑战。在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，挑战包括确保数据的完整性和处理缺失或错误的数据，这些数据会用特定指标标记。与此同时，绿洲-沙漠生态系统研究必须应对环境退化问题，如土地沙漠化和生态失衡，同时还要管理长期观测的数据质量。尽管存在这些差异，两者都强调健全的数据处理和质量控制程序。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the observed patterns in soil temperature and moisture data inform the understanding of energy exchange processes in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 观察到的土壤温度和湿度数据的模式如何帮助理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量交换过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The observed patterns in soil temperature and moisture data, collected at various depths, provide critical insights into the energy exchange processes between the soil and atmosphere in oasis–desert ecosystems. These measurements help infer how soil heat flux and moisture variations contribute to surface energy balance and the regulation of the local microclimate.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在不同深度收集的土壤温度和湿度数据所观察到的模式，为绿洲-沙漠生态系统中土壤与大气之间的能量交换过程提供了重要的见解。这些测量有助于推断土壤热通量和湿度变化如何影响地表能量平衡以及调节局部微气候。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the effectiveness of using thermal infrared cameras and the eddy covariance system in measuring evapotranspiration in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断出，在干旱地区使用热红外相机和涡度协方差系统测量蒸散发的有效性。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of thermal infrared cameras and the eddy covariance system in measuring evapotranspiration in arid regions can reveal the complexities of accurately estimating surface fluxes. These instruments help separate soil and canopy component temperatures, enabling better validation of evaporation and transpiration estimates, even in environments with strong advection and heterogeneous land cover.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 热红外相机和涡度协方差系统在干旱地区测量蒸散发的应用可以揭示准确估计表面通量的复杂性。这些仪器有助于分离土壤和树冠组件的温度，从而更好地验证蒸发和蒸腾的估算，即使在强烈的平流和异质的土地覆盖环境中。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of measuring evaporation and transpiration in arid oasis-desert systems using ground-based methods?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中，使用地面方法测量蒸发和蒸腾面临的挑战的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Evaporation and transpiration are difficult to measure on the ground in arid regions due to the limitations in current composite temperature separation approaches and errors caused by image classification, especially with varying vegetation abundance. The uncertainties in atmospheric upwelling radiation, transmittance, and component temperature estimation further complicate accurate measurement.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，由于当前复合温度分离方法的局限性以及图像分类造成的误差，蒸发和蒸腾的地面测量非常困难，尤其是在植被丰度变化的情况下。大气上行辐射、透射率和组分温度估计的不确定性进一步使得准确测量变得复杂。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why are long-term observations crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial because they provide a quantitative understanding of the interactions between oasis and desert systems, which are essential for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development. These observations help in recognizing the balance necessary for sustaining the oasis environment amidst the challenges posed by climate change and human activities.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观察至关重要，因为它们提供了对绿洲和沙漠系统之间相互作用的定量理解，这对于维持生态稳定和支持可持续发展至关重要。这些观察有助于认识到在气候变化和人类活动带来的挑战下，维持绿洲环境所需的平衡。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes uncertainties in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures in strongly advective environments?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流环境中，估计土壤和冠层组分温度的不确定性原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Uncertainties arise from errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures. This is exacerbated by classification errors in image pixels, which misidentify soil pixels as vegetation, leading to overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, ignoring factors like atmospheric radiation and transmittance can further contribute to these uncertainties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 不确定性源于从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被成分温度时的误差。这种情况因图像像素的分类错误而加剧，这些错误将土壤像素误识别为植被，从而导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽视大气辐射和透射等因素也会进一步增加这些不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects of using a multi-layered meteorological observation system on the quality and reliability of climate data collected in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用多层气象观测系统对干旱地区收集的气候数据的质量和可靠性可能产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a multi-layered meteorological observation system, such as the one described with sensors at different heights, can enhance the quality and reliability of climate data by providing detailed vertical profiles of meteorological variables like wind speed and temperature. This setup helps capture microclimatic variations and can lead to more accurate modeling of surface-atmosphere interactions. However, challenges such as sensor maintenance and data consistency across layers need to be addressed to ensure data reliability.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用多层气象观测系统，例如在不同高度设置传感器，可以通过提供气象变量（如风速和温度）的详细垂直剖面来提高气候数据的质量和可靠性。这种设置有助于捕捉微气候变化，并可以导致对表面-大气相互作用的更准确建模。然而，需要解决传感器维护和各层数据一致性等挑战，以确保数据的可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of incorporating isotopic techniques in validating evapotranspiration measurements in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，采用同位素技术验证蒸散发测量的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Incorporating isotopic techniques, such as stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, in validating evapotranspiration measurements can provide precise partitioning of evaporation and transpiration components, leading to more accurate estimations of water fluxes in oasis-desert systems. This approach enhances the understanding of water cycle dynamics and supports water resource management in arid regions. Yet, it also requires careful calibration and interpretation of isotope data, which can be complex and resource-intensive.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 采用同位素技术，如稳定氧和氢同位素，来验证蒸散发测量可以精确划分蒸发和蒸腾成分，从而更准确地估算绿洲-沙漠系统中的水流动。这种方法增强了对水循环动态的理解，并支持干旱地区的水资源管理。然而，这也需要对同位素数据进行仔细的校准和解释，这可能是复杂且资源密集的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in the context of evapotranspiration estimation for vegetated landscapes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在植被景观的蒸散发估算中，使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives of using the TSEB model in the context of evapotranspiration estimation for vegetated landscapes include accurately estimating evaporation, transpiration, and total evapotranspiration by considering the heterogeneous nature of the landscape. The model aims to improve the understanding and management of the terrestrial water cycle and water resources by providing reliable estimates through the separation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which are validated using field observations and isotopic techniques.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在植被景观的蒸散发估算中使用TSEB模型的目标包括通过考虑景观的异质性，准确估计蒸发、蒸腾和总蒸散发。该模型旨在通过分离土壤和冠层组分的温度，提供可靠的估算，从而改善对陆地水循环和水资源的理解与管理，这些估算通过现场观测和同位素技术进行验证。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to have long-term observational datasets for understanding energy and water vapor exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和水汽交换时，长期观测数据集是必要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are necessary for understanding energy and water vapor exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems because they provide critical insights into the interactions between oases and deserts, which are vital for ecological security and sustainable development. These datasets help in recognizing the basic characteristics and dynamics of these exchanges over time, contributing to the protection of ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development in arid and semi-arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和水汽交换是必要的，因为它们提供了关于绿洲与沙漠之间相互作用的重要见解，这对生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。这些数据集有助于识别这些交换的基本特征和动态，促进生态稳定性的保护，并支持干旱和半干旱地区的社会经济发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What processes are involved in ensuring the quality and integrity of meteorological and hydrological data collected from remote sensing networks in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保从干旱地区的遥感网络收集的气象和水文数据的质量和完整性涉及哪些过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The processes involved in ensuring the quality and integrity of meteorological and hydrological data include daily data checks to ensure completeness (ensuring 144 data points per day), marking missing data with a specific placeholder (-6999), removing duplicate records, deleting data outside the physical or instrumental range, and highlighting questionable data with red markings. The date and time are standardized into a single column, and the data is named according to a specific rule (AWS+Station Name).
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 确保气象和水文数据质量与完整性的过程包括每日数据检查，以确保数据的完整性（确保每天有144个数据点），用特定占位符（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理或仪器范围的数据，并用红色标记突出可疑数据。日期和时间被标准化为一个单独的列，数据根据特定规则命名（AWS+站点名称）。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are advanced remote sensing instruments utilized to measure soil and vegetation temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 先进的遥感仪器如何用于测量异质景观中土壤和植被温度，以估算蒸散发？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Advanced remote sensing instruments, such as a high-resolution thermal infrared camera, are used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures. These temperatures are then used as inputs for the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. The thermal camera captures thermal images from which soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures are extracted. These temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation and emissivity values. The process involves classifying thermal images into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 先进的遥感仪器，如高分辨率热红外相机，用于测量土壤和冠层组件的温度。这些温度随后作为输入用于双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型。热相机捕获热图像，从中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。这些温度通过入射的长波辐射和发射率值转换为辐射温度。该过程涉及使用最大似然法将热图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to collect and process long-term data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，收集和处理能源、水蒸气和碳交换的长期数据的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Long-term data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems are collected using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for turbulent flux data, along with automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data. These observations include radiation, soil heat flux, temperature and humidity profiles, wind speed and direction, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Data processing involves collecting, processing, and archiving data while maintaining quality control. The processed data includes supplementary vegetation and soil parameters and is shared through data centers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集长期的能量、水汽和碳交换数据，同时使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据。这些观测数据包括辐射、土壤热通量、温度和湿度剖面、风速和风向、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。数据处理涉及数据的收集、处理和归档，同时保持质量控制。处理后的数据包括补充的植被和土壤参数，并通过数据中心共享。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What specific data processing and quality control procedures enable the accuracy and reliability of datasets in hydrometeorological studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些具体的数据处理和质量控制程序能够确保水文气象研究中数据集的准确性和可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. These steps ensure the accuracy and reliability of datasets in hydrometeorological studies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享。这些步骤确保了水文气象研究中数据集的准确性和可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems enable a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集如何促进对能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态的更好理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, which include long-term measurements of energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters, enable a comprehensive understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期测量，以及辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数，使我们能够全面理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换的动态。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technologies or methods enable the measurement of turbulent flux data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术或方法能够测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的湍流通量数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The measurement of turbulent flux data in oasis–desert ecosystems is enabled by the use of an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, which provide half-hourly data.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的使用使得湍流通量数据的测量成为可能，这些设备提供半小时的数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring accurate and comprehensive data collection in oasis–desert ecosystems, and what methods can be employed to address these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在确保在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行准确和全面的数据收集时，可能会出现哪些挑战，以及可以采用哪些方法来应对这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological challenges such as drying up of rivers, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. Ensuring accurate data collection might involve long-term observations and the use of automatic weather stations, eddy covariance systems, and scintillometers to obtain comprehensive energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态挑战，如河流干涸、土地沙漠化和频繁的沙尘暴。确保准确的数据收集可能涉及长期观测以及使用自动气象站、涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，以获取全面的能量、水汽和碳通量数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might existing data collection methods for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous land surfaces be insufficient, and what improvements could be made?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 现有的用于估算异质土地表面蒸散发的数据收集方法可能不足的原因是什么？可以做哪些改进？
Expectation.AnswerEn: One-source models may not accurately estimate surface evapotranspiration due to the heterogeneous nature of landscapes. The TSEB model improves this by using soil and canopy component temperatures to better estimate E, T, and ET. Improvements could involve using high-resolution thermal cameras and refining the separation of soil and canopy temperatures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 单源模型可能无法准确估计表面蒸散发，因为景观的异质性。TSEB模型通过使用土壤和冠层组件温度来更好地估计蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），从而改善了这一点。改进措施可以包括使用高分辨率热成像相机和精细化土壤与冠层温度的分离。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expectations regarding the collection and quality control of hydrometeorological data in arid regions, and what techniques can enhance these processes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，对水文气象数据的收集和质量控制的期望是什么，以及有哪些技术可以增强这些过程？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The expectation is to collect comprehensive hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, and moisture profiles. Techniques to enhance these processes include using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period and implementing thorough data processing and quality control procedures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 期望收集全面的水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量和湿度剖面。增强这些过程的技术包括使用具有10分钟平均周期的自动气象站，并实施全面的数据处理和质量控制程序。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the challenges faced in the accurate measurement of energy balance components in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在异质土地表面准确测量能量平衡组成部分所面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Accurately measuring energy balance components in heterogeneous land surfaces like those covered by mixed soil and vegetation is indeed challenging. The complexity arises from factors such as varying resistances to energy exchange and the difficulty of distinguishing between soil and vegetation contributions using composite temperature approaches. These challenges are compounded by environmental conditions like strong advection, making precise measurements difficult.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在混合土壤和植被覆盖的异质土地表面准确测量能量平衡组件确实具有挑战性。复杂性源于能量交换的不同阻力以及使用复合温度方法区分土壤和植被贡献的困难。这些挑战在强平流等环境条件下更加复杂，使得精确测量变得困难。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the potential for expanding the existing datasets to include more comprehensive vegetation and soil parameters?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对扩展现有数据集以包括更全面的植被和土壤参数的潜力有什么看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Expanding existing datasets to include more comprehensive vegetation and soil parameters could significantly enhance the understanding of oasis-desert ecosystems. These parameters are crucial for detailed analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. Incorporating additional data on vegetation types, soil composition, and moisture levels would provide a more holistic view and possibly improve model validation and accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 扩展现有数据集以包括更全面的植被和土壤参数，可以显著增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统的理解。这些参数对于详细分析能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。纳入有关植被类型、土壤成分和湿度水平的额外数据，将提供更全面的视角，并可能提高模型的验证和准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t quite understand how data quality control is ensured when collecting meteorological and soil data in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不太明白在干旱地区收集气象和土壤数据时如何确保数据质量控制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection process involves ensuring 144 data entries daily, with missing data marked by -6999, removing duplicate records, and deleting data that exceeds physical or instrument limits. Additionally, data with uncertainties are marked in red, and consistent formatting for date and time is maintained.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集过程涉及确保每天有144条数据记录，缺失数据用-6999标记，删除重复记录，并删除超出物理或仪器限制的数据。此外，具有不确定性的数据用红色标记，并保持日期和时间的一致格式。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about how the variation in soil and canopy component temperatures is accurately measured and accounted for in such complex environments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在如此复杂的环境中，土壤和树冠成分温度的变化是如何准确测量和考虑的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the research, soil and canopy component temperatures were measured using a high-resolution thermal camera. These temperatures were then calculated by classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels. The radiation temperatures were derived from thermal infrared temperatures, considering incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在研究中，使用高分辨率热像仪测量了土壤和冠层组件的温度。这些温度通过将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素来计算。辐射温度是通过考虑入射的长波辐射和发射率，从热红外温度中推导出来的。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore different data collection methods for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems and discuss their potential challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的不同数据收集方法，并讨论它们可能面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the field of oasis–desert ecosystems, data collection methods include the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux measurements, as well as automatic weather stations for gathering hydrometeorological data such as soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, and gradients of air temperature and humidity. Challenges include maintaining long-term datasets, ensuring data quality control, and addressing environmental degradation issues such as land desertification and drying up of water bodies in arid regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统领域，数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行湍流通量测量，以及自动气象站收集水文气象数据，如土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面以及空气温度和湿度的梯度。面临的挑战包括维持长期数据集、确保数据质量控制，以及应对环境退化问题，如干旱地区的土地沙漠化和水体干涸。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and describe potential datasets that could be integrated with existing hydrometeorological observations to enhance the understanding of oasis–desert interactions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和描述可以与现有水文气象观测数据集成的潜在数据集，以增强对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets that could be integrated with existing hydrometeorological observations include datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, containing long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. Additional auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters, as well as groundwater table data, could further enhance understanding. These datasets are crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting sustainable development goals.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集可以与现有的水文气象观测数据集成，包括来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的数据，包含长期的能量、水蒸气和碳通量。额外的辅助数据涉及植被和土壤参数，以及地下水位数据，这些都可以进一步增强理解。这些数据集对于识别绿洲–沙漠相互作用和支持可持续发展目标至关重要。
